title: Firefox for OS 10.11.6
content:
Hello

Hoping someone can help me with this asap.

I was prompted to update firefox on my mac laptop.

So I did the update by clicking the button available at the top of the firefox browser, but now I can not open Firefox at all.

When I click on the firefox icon it does not open firefox and this message appears: You can't use this version of the application "Firefox with the version of OS X. You have OS X 10.11.6 . The application requires OS X 10.12 or later.

I understand what this means but not sure how to revert back to the previous version of firefox.

When installing the new update/version of firefox, i have deleted the old version of firefox.

I am following these instructions currently to try to resolve it: https://www.wikihow.com/Downgrade-Firefox

Following the instructions above I went to: https://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/firefox/releases/ , but can not find the previous version of firefox that I need.

The only info I have on firefox is version 102.2.0. I am after the version before this as assume that is the one compatable with my laptop currently (i can not update the OS ).

Can you help me download the previous version so it is compatable with my mac laptop?

Thanks for your help in advance
creator: macuser_1

title: Settings
content: I am unable to access the settings menu from the upper right corner. Can you please instruct me on how to get to settings menu? Thanks

title: Firefox home page shortcuts are not being displayed
content:
I’m trying to help a friend restore the shortcuts in the Firefox home page. He is using Windows 11.

In Tools > Settings > Home > Firefox Home Content, he has the Shortcuts box checked but nothing shows up on the Home page. He remembers seeing the icons long time ago but doesn’t know why they’re not there now.

Is there some other setting that needs to be enabled? Thanks
creator: Mike109

title: How do I know that my Firefox Private Network Browser Extension is installed and working?
content:
Hi, I'm new to Firefox and purchased Mozilla's Firefox Private Network Browser Extension. How can I tell that it's on? Should I be seeing some sort of icon on my address bar or something? And what could be the problem if it isn't on?

Compared to Chrome, when I login then a can see extension icons on the bar. Should I be signing on to Firefox too?
creator: brentxphillips

title: Google Drive Not Working
content: Hello, I know it may sound like a Google issue, however, when I used Google Chrome as a browser instead, I did not have this problem. Now, when I'm on Google Drive, whenever I try to make a new folder it has the message "Working" in the corner forever & it won't allow me to create a new Google Docs, Slides, Sheets, or Form. I tried making a new folder on my phone & Google Chrome, and they both worked fine. I use Firefox as my default browser, and I want to keep it this way, however, if I can't use Google Drive with your browser, I might have to switch because I'm in college, and need Google Drive for my work. Thank you. Jenna Senior
creator: jenna.senior3js

title: Firefox refusing to launch / closing every 30 seconds.
content: I got a new laptop today and have been having trouble with firefox. It ran fine at first, I even managed to sync it over from my old laptop, extensions, history, etc. and all, but after a few openings and closings, it crashed at some point. After that it refused to open, so me and a friend troubleshooted for about 30 minutes to no avail (clean reinstalled multiple times, restarted my laptop, troubleshooted compatability, etc.). At some point after my friend had logged off, I noticed my taskbar refresh and then was able to open firefox, but then it crashed again and I wasn't able to open it. I manually refreshed my windows explorer with task manager and was able to open it, and tried everything firefox says to: cleared my start-up cache, opened it in trouble shoot mode, refreshed it. It still crashed every single time, and I ended up doing all at once, then in different orders, etc. Nothing worked. I decided to time how long I got and it ended up being exactly 30 seconds between restarting my windows explorer and firefox crashing again. Any suggestions?
creator: weitzel.charlotte

title: Banking pages won't advance beyong Loading pop up
content: After logging in to banking website, selecting any action after landing page results in just a greyed-out loading popup with Asterisk symbol showing working clockwise action. Tab continues and won't even auto time out disconnect like it should. must close tab to exit. Edge browser works fine on site, problem just began this week (update glitch ?)
creator: TGCBM
